conclusion: To determine whether the motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is the same as or opposite to the defined positive direction, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The x-axis represents time t in seconds. The y-axis represents velocity v in meters per second (m/s). The graph shows how the velocity of the particle changes over time.
We are interested in the time interval from t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity v is 0 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity v is -2 m/s.

premise: A positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction. A negative velocity indicates motion in the negative direction.
conclusion: From t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds, the velocity is negative (-2 m/s).

premise: Since the velocity is negative during this interval, the particle is moving in the negative direction.
conclusion: The negative direction is opposite to the defined positive direction.

premise: The negative direction is opposite to the defined positive direction.
conclusion: The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
